title: ATP production in mitochondria and chloroplasts

content.description: The figures below illustrate the similarities between ATP synthesis in mitochondria and chloroplasts.
content.question: The figures can best assist in answering which of the following questions?

choices.label: Do electron transport chains create a gradient so that ATP synthase can generate ATP molecules?
What are the sources of energy that drive mitochondrial and chloroplast electron transport systems?
What is the optimal temperature at which ATP synthase chemically converts ADP and a phosphate group into one molecule of ATP?
What is the evolutionary relationship between the ATP synthase in mitochondria and the ATP synthase in chloroplasts?

content.answer: Do electron transport chains create a gradient so that ATP synthase can generate ATP molecules?

skill.text: 2.C: Explain how biological models relate to larger principles, concepts, processes, systems, or theories.
